We enjoyed cooking meals in the kitchen each day, as well as the Keurig coffee pot. We also enjoyed the beautiful covered patio, complete with a picnic table and porch swing. I enjoyed sitting out there at night with a drink and taking in the sounds of the trains in sleepy little South Fork. Our Corgi's loved the big back yard, and we were so happy to find a pet friendly home! The upstairs was beautiful in its own right. 3 comfortable rooms with one queen bed, one double bed, and an attached room with bunk beds. The beds and pillows were heavenly! The upstairs bathroom had a wonderful shower, and the entire place was squeaky clean. Plenty of closet space, as well! The carpeting was new and plush. We had several questions for Joe throughout our stay, and he was very speedy in answering us. He even left a local newspaper on the front porch for us daily. It was also a very hot week, and the downstairs and upstairs AC kept the house very cool and comfortable. We enjoyed our week at Joe's place. It felt like home, and we didn't want to leave. We made many family memories that are sure to last a lifetime. We will be back!

We also really appreciated that the dresser in each room had big mirrors attached as well as great lighting so that we could do hair & makeup outside the bathroom.
One note: the stairs at the entrance are rather steep. It wasn't a problem for us but might be if you have trouble with stairs.
The location in downtown Johnstown fit our needs perfectly. If you are going to Jtown for sightseeing, you will be just a block or two from the Flood Museum, Amtrack is across the street, grocery store is less than a mile away as are the Incline Plane and the stadium. Don't forget to pick up some Coney Island dogs and some gobs!
This space made this our most comfortable trip back to Johnstown yet. Ed & Leah were very accommodating with some small needs we had on arrival--very gracious hosts! We look forward to staying here again.

Big, spacious, squeaky clean apartment all to your self. Early 1900s architecture and mid century furnishing, with an industrial vibe makes this a fun place to stay. The mattresses are modern and really comfortable (clearly not the owners hand me down). Really large full bathroom with clawfoot tub and a dramatic 4 season porch. From the corkscrew to tons of fresh white towels, no detail is missed by our host.
The location is across from a sleepy Amtrak station (the trains are not noisy, and present only as low rumble) and super close to Main street Johnstown. You can almost throw a rock at the Johnstown Flood Museum. Minutes from the Johnstown Funicular, art galleries, shops, Heritage Discovery Center, Historic Grandview Cemetery.
Had a great meal from Balance on Main Street. Parking is metered and coin operated. 30 mn per half hour. Remember to grab some quarters, but there was plenty of on street parking or a municipal parking garage is available where you can pay with a card at the kiosk before exiting. Asiago Italian restaurant is just up the hill near the Grandview Cemetery and the top of the funicular and its gift shop. Curbside ordered dinner on second night from them. Convenient and good food to take back to the apartment. Check out the eclectic Westmont neighborhood tucked between Grandview and the top of the funicular before returning to the apartment.
Do not miss the many public parks in the area. Do not be intimidated by the hills. Stackhouse Park is close by and includes paths for every level of walk/hike ability. We were there early spring as things were just starting to green up. Great views or babbling brook, its all here. Will comeback in the high season to check out the Mill Rats play ball.
